trans-unit.source: Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers
trans-unit.target: Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers

trans-unit.source: The following Table service operations are OData-compatible:
trans-unit.target: The following Table service operations are OData-compatible:

trans-unit.source: When you call one of these operations, you must specify the OData data service version, using one of the following request headers:
trans-unit.target: When you call one of these operations, you must specify the OData data service version, using one of the following request headers:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference>, to specify the maximum data service version
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference>, to specify the maximum data service version

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference>, to specify the exact data service version
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference>, to specify the exact data service version

trans-unit.source: If both headers are present, precedence is given to <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If both headers are present, precedence is given to <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the headers which specify the OData protocol version are similar to the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, which indicates the version of the Table service to use when making a request against the service.
trans-unit.target: Note that the headers which specify the OData protocol version are similar to the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, which indicates the version of the Table service to use when making a request against the service.

trans-unit.source: You must specify both headers for the operations listed above.
trans-unit.target: You must specify both headers for the operations listed above.

trans-unit.source: Not all versions of the Table service are compatible with all OData data service versions, so you must ensure that both <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference>/<parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> are set to compatible versions, as summarized in the following table:
trans-unit.target: Not all versions of the Table service are compatible with all OData data service versions, so you must ensure that both <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference>/<parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> are set to compatible versions, as summarized in the following table:

trans-unit.source: Compatible Table Service Versions (x-ms-version Header Values)
trans-unit.target: Compatible Table Service Versions (x-ms-version Header Values)

trans-unit.source: Note that if you are accessing the Table service using the Azure Storage Client Library, these headers are automatically set for you.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you are accessing the Table service using the Azure Storage Client Library, these headers are automatically set for you.
